Generation I.Red: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. Its vines shake as it walks.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. Its vines shake as it walks.
Generation I.Yellow: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick, blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
Generation I.Stadium: Its identity is obscured by countless blue vines that are similar to seaweed. Will become entangled with anything.

Generation II.Gold: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively unnerve its foes.
Generation II.Silver: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
Generation II.Crystal: During battle, it constantly moves the vines that cover its body in order to annoy its opponent.
Generation II.Stadium 2: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively unnerve its foes. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Tangela 's vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
Generation III.Sapphire: Tangela 's vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
Generation III.Emerald: Its vines snap off easily and painlessly if they are grabbed, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by new growth the very next day.
Generation III.FireRed: Blue plant vines cloak the Pok é mon 's identity in a tangled mass. It entangles anything that gets close.
Generation III.LeafGreen: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to seaweed. The vines sway as it walks.

Generation IV.Diamond: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
Generation IV.Pearl: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
Generation IV.Platinum: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
Generation IV.HeartGold: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively unnerve its foes.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.

Generation V.Black: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
Generation V.White: The blue vines shrouding its body are covered in a growth of fine hair. It is known to be ticklish.
Generation V.Black 2: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
Generation V.White 2: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

Generation VI.X: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.
Generation VI.Y: It tangles any moving thing with its vines. Their subtle shaking is ticklish if you get ensnared.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Tangela's vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Tangela's vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Its identity is obscured by masses of thick blue vines. The vines are said to never stop growing.

Generation VIII.Sword: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.
Generation VIII.Shield: The vines of a Tangela have a distinct scent. In some parts of Galar, Tangela vines are used as herbs.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It is shrouded by blue vines. No one has seen the face hidden behind this growth of vines.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed—they're useful as a spice.
